titleStmt.title: A pleasant new ballad to sing both even and morne, of the bloody murther of Sir John Barley-corne. To the tune of, Shall I lye beyond thee.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Iohn Wright, and are to be sold at his shop in Guilt-spurre street at the signe of the Bible,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "As I went through the North coun-(trey ..."
Includes 2 ballads; second ballad has title: A new ballad for you to looke on, how Mault doth deale with every one.
Cut in half, mounted with second ballad first.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
